result.execSummary:
The defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Register as sex offender & sex offender assessment/treatment.  Risk & needs assessment and any other.  compy with all treatment requirements.  No contact w/L.H., A.M.H., A.M.H., and M.H.  No contact with minors under age of 18 w/out agent approval.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and Attorney Covey received copies of PSI, memorandum and reports.  All documents have been reviewed. Attorney Covey advises of some corrections.  Victim statements also reviewed by counsel and defendant.  Defendant prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Attorney Covey calls Lorrie Roller, Psycho therapist.  Sworn & testifies.  Goes through employment and education.  Goes through report findings.  State cross examines.  Attorney Covey redirect of Lorrie Roller.  States calls L.H., mother of victims and stepmother of defendant.  Calls A.H., victim for statement.  Laura Moffit, Victim Witness Coord., reads statement of A.M.H., victim.  Attorney Covey states corrections of PSI.  State gives sentencing recommendation of Count 1-3 years I.C., 8 years extended. Count 2-8 years I.C., 3 years extended, consecutive.  Attorney Covey argues sentence.  Attorney Covey addresses dairies of defendant.  Court instructs all diary entries, victim statements, reports and PSI to be sealed.  Attorney Covey continues with sentencing recommendation.  7 years probation each count with conditions.  90-120 days conditional jail/with Huber; release to housing.  Defendant makes statement.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1 :
WI State Prison for 10 years (7 years Initial Confinement/3 years Extended Supervision)  394 days credit.
Count 2:  Sentence withheld:
Probation 10 years, consecutive to Count 1.  
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
Register as sex offender and sex offender treatment and assessment
Risk and needs assessment and any other 
Comply with all treatment requirements
No contact with L.H., A.M.H., A.M.H., M.H.
No contact with minors under age of 18 years w/out agent approval.  
$268.00 Costs x 2 & Supervision Fees
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Earned Release
Paperwork handed in court.
Lorrie Roller, MSW
Cover Letter from Atty. Covey
Sentencing hearing at 08-27-2015 09:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 08-04-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states matter is resolved and states agreement/charges alleged in 3 page police report are not to be charged as part of agreement.  Atty Covey agrees but notes they are denying information in the 3 page police report referred to.  Atty Covey enters NC pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings/voting rights.  Court orders PSI be completed no later than 7/24/2015.  Sentencing hearing to be set.  Bond continued pending sentencing.

Atty Woodard notes he will be counsel for DE even though he's going to Dane Co as of next week, then he acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Court states case and State states appearances.  DE will waive her right to prelim today.  Atty Woodard is in agreement.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause.

Defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L. Steinman and intern.  Defendant Amberlyn M. Higgins in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests cash bond of $10,000.  Intern responds.  Parties argue.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $10,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with L.H. or her three children (AMH 7/1/98, AMH 4/29/2000 or M.H.) or their residence, or w/any child under 18 years of age and not to leave the State of Wisconsin w/o permission from the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
